Subsetting and subassignment

Source: vignettes/subassign.Rmd
subassign.Rmd
library(tibble)

This vignette is an attempt to provide a comprehensive overview over all subsetting and subassignment operations, highlighting where the tibble implementation differs from the data frame implementation.

new_df <- function() {
  df <- data.frame(a = 1:4)
  df$b = letters[5:8]
  df$cd <- list(9, 10:11, 12:14, "text")
  df
}

new_tbl <- function() {
  as_tibble(new_df())
}
new_df()
#>   a b         cd
#> 1 1 e          9
#> 2 2 f     10, 11
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text
 
new_tbl()
#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0
#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.

#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0
#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.

#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0
#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>

Subsetting

Subsetting operations are read-only.

df <- new_df()
 
tbl <- new_tbl()

$

With $ subsetting, accessing a missing column gives a warning. Inexact matching is not supported:

df$a
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
tbl$a
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
df$"a"
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
tbl$"a"
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
df$a[2:3]
#> [1] 2 3
 
tbl$a[2:3]
#> [1] 2 3
 
df$cd
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 9
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] 10 11
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 12 13 14
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] "text"
 
tbl$cd
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 9
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] 10 11
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 12 13 14
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] "text"
 
df$c
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 9
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] 10 11
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 12 13 14
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] "text"
 
tbl$c
#> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised
#> column: 'c'.
#> NULL
 
df$d
#> NULL
 
tbl$d
#> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised
#> column: 'd'.
#> NULL

[[

The exact argument is not supported by tibbles. With two indexes, a single element is returned. Exotic variants like recursive indexing are deprecated for tibbles.

df[["a"]]
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
tbl[["a"]]
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
df[["cd", exact = TRUE]]
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 9
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] 10 11
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 12 13 14
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] "text"
 
tbl[["cd", exact = TRUE]]
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 9
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] 10 11
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 12 13 14
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] "text"
 
df[["cd", exact = FALSE]]
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 9
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] 10 11
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 12 13 14
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] "text"
 
tbl[["cd", exact = FALSE]]
#> Warning: exact ignored
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 9
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] 10 11
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 12 13 14
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] "text"
 
df[["c", exact = TRUE]]
#> NULL
 
tbl[["c", exact = TRUE]]
#> Warning: Calling `[[` with an unknown
#> column name is deprecated and will
#> eventually be converted to an error.
#> NULL
 
df[["c", exact = FALSE]]
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 9
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] 10 11
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 12 13 14
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] "text"
 
tbl[["c", exact = FALSE]]
#> Warning: exact ignored
#> Warning: Calling `[[` with an unknown
#> column name is deprecated and will
#> eventually be converted to an error.
#> NULL
 
df[[2, "a"]]
#> [1] 2
 
tbl[[2, "a"]]
#> [1] 2
 
df[[2, "cd"]]
#> [1] 10 11
 
tbl[[2, "cd"]]
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 10 11
 
df[[1:2, "cd"]]
#> Error in col[[i, exact = exact]]: subscript out of bounds
 
tbl[[1:2, "cd"]]
#> `i` must have size 1, not size 2.
 
df[[2, "c"]]
#> NULL
 
tbl[[2, "c"]]
#> Warning: Calling `[[` with an unknown
#> column name is deprecated and will
#> eventually be converted to an error.
#> NULL
 
df[[1:2, "c"]]
#> NULL
 
tbl[[1:2, "c"]]
#> Warning: Calling `[[` with an unknown
#> column name is deprecated and will
#> eventually be converted to an error.
#> NULL
 
df[[c(1, 2)]]
#> [1] 2
 
tbl[[c(1, 2)]]
#> Warning: Calling `[[` with a vector
#> of length 2 (recursive subsetting)
#> is deprecated and will eventually be
#> converted to an error.
#> [1] 2

[

With [ subsetting, tibbles always return a tibble. The drop argument is supported but has different defaults:

df["a"]
#>   a
#> 1 1
#> 2 2
#> 3 3
#> 4 4
 
tbl["a"]
#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0
#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.
#> # A tibble: 4 x 1
#>       a
#> * <int>
#> 1     1
#> 2     2
#> 3     3
#> 4     4
 
df["a", drop = FALSE]
#> Warning in `[.data.frame`(df, "a",
#> drop = FALSE): 'drop' argument will be
#> ignored
#>   a
#> 1 1
#> 2 2
#> 3 3
#> 4 4
 
tbl["a", drop = FALSE]
#> Warning: drop ignored

#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0
#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.
#> # A tibble: 4 x 1
#>       a
#> * <int>
#> 1     1
#> 2     2
#> 3     3
#> 4     4
 
df["a", drop = TRUE]
#> Warning in `[.data.frame`(df, "a", drop
#> = TRUE): 'drop' argument will be ignored
#>   a
#> 1 1
#> 2 2
#> 3 3
#> 4 4
 
tbl["a", drop = TRUE]
#> Warning: drop ignored

#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0
#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.
#> # A tibble: 4 x 1
#>       a
#> * <int>
#> 1     1
#> 2     2
#> 3     3
#> 4     4
 
df[, "a"]
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
tbl[, "a"]
#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0
#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.
#> # A tibble: 4 x 1
#>       a
#> * <int>
#> 1     1
#> 2     2
#> 3     3
#> 4     4
 
df[, "a", drop = FALSE]
#>   a
#> 1 1
#> 2 2
#> 3 3
#> 4 4
 
tbl[, "a", drop = FALSE]
#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0
#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.
#> # A tibble: 4 x 1
#>       a
#> * <int>
#> 1     1
#> 2     2
#> 3     3
#> 4     4
 
df[, "a", drop = TRUE]
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
tbl[, "a", drop = TRUE]
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
df[c("a", "b")]
#>   a b
#> 1 1 e

#> 3 3 g

#> 3     3 g    
#> 4     4 h
 
df[, c("a", "b")]
#>   a b
#> 1 1 e
#> 2 2 f
#> 3 3 g
#> 4 4 h
 
tbl[, c("a", "b")]
#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0

df[1, ]

#> 1 1 e  9
 
tbl[1, ]
#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0

#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>

Subassignment

For subassignment, we need a fresh copy of the data for each test. The with_*() functions allow for a more concise notation (with_tbl() omitted here for brevity):

with_df <- function(code, verbose = FALSE) {
  code <- rlang::enexpr(code)
  
  full_code <- rlang::quo({
    df <- new_df()
    !!code
    df
  })
  if (verbose) rlang::expr_print(rlang::quo_get_expr(full_code))
  rlang::eval_tidy(full_code)
}

This function takes an assignment expression and executes it on a fresh copy of the data. The first example prints whatâ€™s really executed, further examples omit this output.

with_df(df$a <- rev(df$a), verbose = TRUE)
#> {
#>   df <- new_df()
#>   df$a <- rev(df$a)
#>   df
#> }
#>   a b         cd
#> 1 4 e          9
#> 2 3 f     10, 11
#> 3 2 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 1 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl$a <- rev(tbl$a), verbose = TRUE)
#> {
#>   tbl <- new_tbl()
#>   tbl$a <- rev(tbl$a)
#>   tbl
#> }
#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0
#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.

#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0
#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.

#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0
#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     4 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     2 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     1 h     <chr [1]>

$<-

Scalars and full length

Assigning a scalar or a full-length vector to a column consistently overwrites existing data or appends a new column at the end. Partial matching doesnâ€™t happen:

with_df(df$a <- 1)
#>   a b         cd
#> 1 1 e          9
#> 2 1 f     10, 11
#> 3 1 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 1 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl$a <- 1)
#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0
#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.

#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0
#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.

#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0
#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     1 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     1 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_df(df$b <- 1)
#>   a b         cd
#> 1 1 1          9
#> 2 2 1     10, 11
#> 3 3 1 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 1       text
 
with_tbl(tbl$b <- 1)
#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0
#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.

#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0
#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.

#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0
#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a     b cd       
#>   <int> <dbl> <list>   
#> 1     1     1 <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2     1 <int [2]>
#> 3     3     1 <int [3]>
#> 4     4     1 <chr [1]>
 
with_df(df$c <- 1)
#>   a b         cd c
#> 1 1 e          9 1
#> 2 2 f     10, 11 1
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14 1
#> 4 4 h       text 1
 
with_tbl(tbl$c <- 1)
#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0
#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.

#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0
#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.

#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.

#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>     4
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>     3
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>     2
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>     1
 
with_df(df$cd <- 4:1)
#>   a b cd

#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0

#>   <int> <chr> <int>
#> 1     1 e         4
#> 2     2 f         3
#> 3     3 g         2
#> 4     4 h         1

Recycling

Tibbles allow recycling only for vectors of length 1 or of the same length as the data.

with_df(df$a <- 1:2)
#>   a b         cd
#> 1 1 e          9
#> 2 2 f     10, 11
#> 3 1 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 2 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl$a <- 1:2)
#> Tibble columns must have consistent lengths, only values of length one are recycled:
#> * Length 4: Existing data
#> * Length 2: Column `a`
 
with_df(df$a <- 1:3)
#> Error in `$<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`, a, value = 1:3): replacement has 3 rows, data has 4
 
with_tbl(tbl$a <- 1:3)
#> Tibble columns must have consistent lengths, only values of length one are recycled:
#> * Length 4: Existing data
#> * Length 3: Column `a`
 
with_df(df$a <- 1:5)
#> Error in `$<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`, a, value = 1:5): replacement has 5 rows, data has 4
 
with_tbl(tbl$a <- 1:5)
#> Tibble columns must have consistent lengths, only values of length one are recycled:
#> * Length 4: Existing data
#> * Length 5: Column `a`
 
with_df(df$c <- 1:2)
#>   a b         cd c
#> 1 1 e          9 1
#> 2 2 f     10, 11 2
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14 1
#> 4 4 h       text 2
 
with_tbl(tbl$c <- 1:2)
#> Tibble columns must have consistent lengths, only values of length one are recycled:
#> * Length 4: Existing data
#> * Length 2: Column `c`

Subset assignment

Updating parts of a column extracted by $ is the responsibility of the column vector. Tibbles canâ€™t control what happens after $ has returned.

with_df(df$a[1:2] <- 4:3)
#>   a b         cd
#> 1 4 e          9
#> 2 3 f     10, 11
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl$a[1:2] <- 4:3)

#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.

For columns of the stricter "vctrs_vctr" class, this class implements the check, which then works identically for data frames and tibbles:

with_df({ df$v = vctrs::new_vctr(1:4); df$v[1:2] <- vctrs::new_vctr(4:3)})
#>   a b         cd v
#> 1 1 e          9 4
#> 2 2 f     10, 11 3
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14 3
#> 4 4 h       text 4
with_df({ df$v = vctrs::new_vctr(1:4); df$v[1:2] <- vctrs::new_vctr(letters[4:3])})
#> No common type for `x` <vctrs_vctr> and `value` <vctrs_vctr>.

#> 3     1 x         2
#> 4     1 x         2

Subset assignment

Due to tibbleâ€™s default of drop = FALSE, updating a portion of a [ subset is still safe, because tibble is still in control. Only one example is given here. (FIXME: Itâ€™s not safe yet.)

with_df(df["a"][1, ] <- "b")
#>   a b         cd
#> 1 b e          9
#> 2 2 f     10, 11
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl["a"][1, ] <- "b")
#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0
#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.

#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0
#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.

#> Warning: `as_character()` is deprecated as of rlang 0.4.0
#> Please use `vctrs::vec_cast()` instead.
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>   a     b     cd       
#>   <chr> <chr> <list>   
#> 1 b     e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2 2     f     <int [2]>
#> 3 3     g     <int [3]>
#> 4 4     h     <chr [1]>
